main event: A sighting of a star-like object, possibly a balloon or astronomical phenomenon, was reported in Lake Worth, Florida on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 3 seconds and involved an object that appeared to have a disc-like size and moved between clouds., A handwritten document included in the report confirmed the observations of unusual sizes, movement, and colors., It was noted that possible explanations for the sighting were labeled as probably a balloon or astronomical event., The report was part of Project Blue Book, which studied unidentified flying objects., Local intelligence was involved, and reports indicated that a Russian satellite was sighted around the same time.
witness description: The report mentions a household witness but does not provide specific details about the witness.
